position.title: POST-DOCTORAL RESEARCHER in MODEL-DRIVEN ENGINEERING

description.vision: We are seeking a postdoctoral researcher to explore model-driven, structured engineering. Our work emphasizes tracking model changes rather than model states, improving our understanding of engineering history and enabling advanced services such as collaborative modeling, live constraint checking, and conflict detection.
key_areas: Supervision and mentoring of doctoral and other students
Leading and supporting publications in high-impact venues
Designing and conducting experimental and empirical studies
Contributing to grant writing and research proposal development
Overseeing and guiding software development efforts
Connecting the dots between various student works to push the bigger picture
Teaching responsibilities (equivalent to 4 semester hours per week)

requirements: hold a Doctorate/Ph.D. degree in Informatics or a related academic area
have a strong command of English

duration_and_salary.cost_of_living: Austria offers a relatively affordable cost of living, and low-cost housing options for university employees may be available.

position.local_industry_interest: significant interest in addressing the broader challenges of developing software-intensive systems, particularly in the context of hardware/software co-modeling.

university_profile.description: The research will be conducted in Linz, Austria—a vibrant city located just north of the Alps, known for being safe, clean, and healthy.

nearby_city.name: Vienna
nearby_city.description: has repeatedly been ranked the world’s most livable city.

group_profile.description: Our research group at the Johannes Kepler University, Linz, Austria consists of a dynamic, multi-national staff of researchers.
achievements: recognition in Communications of the ACM (2007)
group_profile.alumni_success: many of our former postdoctoral researchers have gone on to secure prestigious professorships worldwide.

application_details.application_process: Applications, including a detailed curriculum vitae (in English), should be sent to Prof. Alexander Egyed.
requirements: one page description of your research interests and how it connects to our work.

contact_information.full_name: Univ.-Prof. Dr. DI Alexander Egyed, MSc.
